project_name: DeSoto County Regional Wastewater Treatment Plant Expansion - Phase 1
description: Demolition, site work and addition to a water / sewer project in Arcadia, Florida. Completed plans call for the addition of a water / sewer project; for the demolition of a water / sewer project; and for site work for a water / sewer project. GENERAL DeSoto County is seeking qualified Contractors to perform an expansion of treatment capacity and other auxiliary improvements to the existing DeSoto County Regional Wastewater Treatment Plant (DCR WWTP). The DCR WWTP is an extended aeration facility, located on a 160-acre County owned parcel on SE Highway 31, with a current permitted capacity of 0.950 million gallons per day (MGD) average daily flow. DeSoto County is proceeding with the first phase of the expansion to increase the DCR WWTP treatment and disposal capacity to 1.4 MGD. The adjacent 600-acre sprayfield site used for effluent disposal is presently leased by the County from a private landowner. The Base Scope includes the following proposed improvements: demolition work; site ci
reasoning: The project is exclusively focused on wastewater treatment plant expansion, site work, and demolition, with no indication of interior building construction or specific interior material needs relevant to USG products.

project_name: Radar Feedback Signs for Legacy Trail
description:
Site work for a road / highway in Sarasota, Florida. Completed plans call for site work for a road / highway. The project includes the complete turnkey supply and installation of six solar-powered speed radar feedback signs with variable messaging, including all necessary solar components, mounting hardware, and poles.
